Model steps

AutoML

class vpipe.steps.models.automl.AutoML(**kwargs)[source]

As a supervised learning algorithm must be preceded by the supervised learningstep establishing the prediction strategy (direct/recursive). Try different algorithms for forecasting with FLAML (https://microsoft.github.io/FLAML/) or pycaret

"hyperparams_config":[
{
    "id":"h01",
    "enabled":true,
    "step_name":"AutoML",
    "params":{
        "horizon": 7,         # prediction horizon - mandatory
        "frequency": "W",      # forecast frequency - mandatory 
        "time_budget": 300,  # timebudget for automl - default: 300
        "models": [] #list of models to be passed (see the respective automl documentation to verify possibilities)
        "use_pycaret": false, # if to use pycaret, if false than flaml is used - default: false
        "flaml_params": {}, # params for flaml: metric, eval_method, task - default: wape, "cv", "regression" ; respectvely 
        "pycaret_params": {}, # params for pycaret 
        "cross_validation": false, #if cross validation will be performed - default: false
        "cross_params_dict": {},   #dictionary with keys being the params to vary in CV and values the possible values
        "cross_lookback": 52,  # size of the train set in CV (how many timestep will be taken in each fold)
        "cross_folds": 5,    #number of cross folds in CV
        "remove_unrealted_leading_features": false,  # for the model of time step +x, consider only future feature of +x (discard, features of +x-1, +x+1, ...) -default: false
    }
}

]

Methods

fit(mo[, y])

Fit a AutoML model.

Get parameters for this estimator.

predict(mo)

Method that use the fitted models to make the prediction.

fit(mo: vbrainer.pipeline.model_objects.ml_model_object.MLModelObject, y=None)[source]

Fit a AutoML model. As a supervised learning algorithm, needs the supervised prep step to be present in the pipeline before the model.

Parameters
mo.data_mapdict
supervised_dataset

Pandas dataframe containing the features. Established in the supervised prep step

supervised_target

Pandas dataframe containing the target dataset. Established in the supervised prep step

mo.env_varsdict
prediction_strategy

Prediction Strategy defined in the supervised prep step

supervised_categorical_columns

Columns that must be treated as categorical, defined in the supervised prep step

Returns
mo.env_vars: dict
model_features

Dictionary containing two keys: “feature_columns”: (with a list of the columns used in training) and “feature_importance” (with the average feature_importance of collumns)

vflow_client

vflow client, only used for pycaret

self.models: dict

Dictionary saved as a propertie of the class, that varies according to prediction strategy (defined in the supervised prep step). Each key is the future time step (“demand+0”, “demand+1”, …) and the value is tyhe model trained for the timestep

predict(mo: vbrainer.pipeline.model_objects.ml_model_object.MLModelObject)[source]

Method that use the fitted models to make the prediction. As a supervised leanring class, the supervised prep step need to be part of the pipeline before the step.

Parameters
mo.env_vardict
ref_date

Reference date for the forecast period

mo.data_mapdict
supervised_dataset

Pandas dataframe containing the features. Established in the supervised prep step

Returns
mo.data_mapdict
supervised_dataset

Pandas dataframe containing the forecast.

CP estimator

class vpipe.steps.models.cp_estimator.CPEstimator(**kwargs)[source]

Method that use a moving average as prediction, first calcuçating and choosing the best window period. Works for daily data

{
    "id":"h01",
    "enabled":true,
    "step_name":"CPModel",
    "params":{
        "horizon": 7,         # prediction horizon - mandatory
        "frequency": "W",      # forecast frequency - mandatory 
    }
}

Methods

Get parameters for this estimator.

Set the parameters of this estimator.

LGBM estimator

class vpipe.steps.models.lgbm_estimator.LGBM(**kwargs)[source]

As a supervised learning algorithm must be preceded by the supervised learningstep establishing the prediction strategy (direct/recursive).

{
   "id":"h01",
   "enabled":true,
   "step_name":"LGBM",
   "params":{
      "horizon": 7,         # prediction horizon - mandatory
      "frequency": "W",      # forecast frequency - mandatory 
      "lgbm_params": {},  # dictionary with all possible lgbm params to be passed to the model
      "cross_validation": false, #if cross validation will be performed - default: false
      "cross_params_dict": {},   #dictionary with keys being the params to vary in CV and values the possible values
      "cross_lookback": 52,  # size of the train set in CV (how many timestep will be taken in each fold)
      "cross_folds": 5,    #number of cross folds in CV
      "remove_unrealted_leading_features": false,  # for the model of time step +x, consider only future feature of +x (discard, features of +x-1, +x+1, ...) -default: false
   }
}

Methods

model_features

Dictionary containing two keys: “feature_columns”: (with a list of the columns used in training) and “feature_importance” (with the average feature_importance of collumns)

self.models: dict

Dictionary saved as a propertie of the class, that varies according to prediction strategy (defined in the supervised prep step). Each key is the future time step (“demand+0”, “demand+1”, …) and the value is tyhe model trained for the timestep

Moving Average

class vpipe.steps.models.moving_average.MovingAverage(**kwargs)[source]

Fits a moving average

{
    "id":"h01",
    "enabled":true,
    "step_name":"MovingAverage",
    "params":{
        "horizon": 7,         # prediction horizon - mandatory
        "frequency": "W",      # forecast frequency - mandatory
        "lookback": 12        # defines the window size for which the moving avergae will be calculated - defaul: horizon
    }
}

Methods

fit(X[, y])

Fit the moving average algorithm by calculating the mean for each item location pair, the mean is calculated based on a time window defined as the "lookback".

get_params([deep])

Get parameters for this estimator.

predict(mo)

Method that use the fitted models to make the prediction.

set_params(**params)

Set the parameters of this estimator.

get_exec_param

get_exec_params

override_creation_params

override_exec_params

transform
fit(X, y=None)[source]

Fit the moving average algorithm by calculating the mean for each item location pair, the mean is calculated based on a time window defined as the “lookback”.

Returns
self.mean_dictionary: dict

Dictionary with the pair item location as key and the historical mean as value

predict(mo: vbrainer.pipeline.model_objects.ml_model_object.MLModelObject)[source]

Method that use the fitted models to make the prediction. As a supervised leanring class, the supervised prep step need to be part of the pipeline before the step.

Parameters
mo.env_vardict
ref_date

Reference date for the forecast period

Returns
mo.data_mapdict
supervised_dataset

Pandas dataframe containing the forecast.

Sarimax

class vpipe.steps.models.sarimax.Sarimax(**kwargs)[source]

The other params in the params file could be seen in more details in pmdarima’s documentation

{
    "id":"h01",
    "enabled":true,
    "step_name":"Sarimax",
    "params":{
        "has_related_data": false,         # if there is exogenous variables in the dataset
        "trend": "t",
        "start_p":1, 
        "start_q":1,
        "seasonal":true,
        "m":1,
        "start_P":1,
        "start_Q":1,
        "max_p":5,
        "max_d":5,
        "max_q":5,
        "max_P":5,
        "max_Q":5, 
        "max_D":5,
        "max_order" : 100
    }
}

]

Methods

fit(X[, y])

Method that fits the SARIMAX and save the models into an attribute called models_sarimax using all the other step functions from the class

Get parameters for this estimator.

Method predict from the class SARIMAX

XGBoost estimator

class vpipe.steps.models.xgboost_estimator.XGBoost(**kwargs)[source]

As a supervised learning algorithm must be preceded by the supervised learningstep establishing the prediction strategy (direct/recursive).

{
    "id":"h01",
    "enabled":true,
    "step_name":"XGBoost",
    "params":{
        "horizon": 7,         # prediction horizon - mandatory
        "frequency": "W",      # forecast frequency - mandatory 
        "xgboost_params": {},  # dictionary with all possible xgboost params to be passed to the model
        "cross_validation": false, #if cross validation will be performed - default: false
        "cross_params_dict": {},   #dictionary with keys being the params to vary in CV and values the possible values
        "cross_lookback": 52,  # size of the train set in CV (how many timestep will be taken in each fold)
        "cross_folds": 5,    #number of cross folds in CV
        "remove_unrealted_leading_features": false,  # for the model of time step +x, consider only future feature of +x (discard, features of +x-1, +x+1, ...) -default: false
    }
}
